Back to Library
Amphibians are any organism that is able to live both on land and in water
Bacteria are tiny organisms (living things) that have only one cell
The platypus is a duck-billed, beaver-tailed, otter-footed, egg-laying aquatic creature native to Australia
The digestive system breaks down food and absorbs nutrients for energy and growth.
The Heart is a muscle that pumps blood to all parts of your body. The blood pumped by your heart provides your body with the oxygen and nutrients it needs to function.

ImagePreview
Cells are the super tiny building blocks that make up all living things, like plants, animals, and even you! They\'re so small you need a microscope to see them!
Biodiversity is all the different kinds of life – plants, animals, and everything else – living together and connected in their environments.
An organism is any single thing that is alive, like a plant, an animal, or even a tiny bug you can barely see! If it eats, grows, and can make more of itself, it\'s an organism.
the science or occupation of cultivating the soil, producing crops, and raising livestock
Medicine, in its most general sense, refers to any substance used to treat, cure, prevent, or diagnose a disease.

Reptiles are a diverse group of vertebrates characterized by having dry, scaly skin and being cold-blooded. They are typically egg-laying and include animals like snakes, lizards, turtles, and crocodiles.
A forest is a place with lots and lots of trees, and it\'s a home for many plants and animals. It\'s like a big, green playground and a very important part of our Earth.

The term \'ocean\' comes from the Latin word “ōkeanos,” which literally translates to the “great stream encircling the earth\'s disc.” This was used by the Greeks to describe the single mass of water that they believed surrounded the earth.
A river is a big stream of moving water that flows across the land, usually starting in the mountains or hills and flowing towards the ocean, a lake, or another river.
Soil is the top layer of the ground where plants grow, and it\'s made of a mix of broken-down rocks, decaying plants, and tiny living things.
Humans, scientifically known as Homo sapiens, are a species of primate characterized by bipedalism, hairlessness, and high intelligence.
Acacia trees are recognized by their distinctive feathery or fern-like leaves, which can be either true leaves or flattened leaf stalks called phyllodes
biological simply means relating to life or living organisms. When we describe something as biological, we are saying that it has to do with living things, how they function, or their origins.

Species refers to a group of similar organisms that are able to reproduce. This is part of how scientists classify, meaning to organize or compare living things. We are a species as humans, and so are dogs!
